Party with a purpose as we honor McQueen High School student Noah Christensen with the Voice of Tomorrow Award.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Our civil liberties are under attack more than ever before. The ACLU of Nevada has been there every step of the way, ready to defend and protect Nevadans' right to democracy, equality, justice and liberty.

Join us at the Biggest Little Liberty Celebration to celebrate our successes and help us continue the fight on Friday, November 2 at the Renaissance Hotel in Reno.

Biggest Little Liberty Celebration

Join us in Reno for food, drinks, and fun.

Friday, November 2, 6 p.m.
Renaissance Reno
One South Lake St.
Reno, NV 89501

RSVP TODAY

This year we're honoring Noah Christensen with the Voice of Tomorrow Award. You may remember him as the McQueen High School student forced to fight for his First Amendment rights after he was suspended from school for calling his congressman during a student protest.

Funds raised at the Biggest Little Liberty Celebration will support the ACLU of Nevada's work on education, litigation and advocacy.

We hope to see you there!

Sincerely,

ACLU of Nevada
